intro: Cheiridopsis scabra, commonly known as the nakedhead ice plant, is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming succulent that thrives in arid and rocky environments. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in late spring to early summer. Cheiridopsis scabra is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
